Description of completed task:
Completed the Orientation Quiz. 
Created GitHub repository "rate-my-spot" and set up the Project Management Board. Configured columns (Todo, In Progress, Done), linked the board to the repo, and set visibility to Public.
Conducted technical research and drafted the initial database schema.

Initialized both the backend and frontend projects. 
Implemented 8 core backend entities (User, Spot, Post, etc.)
Challenges and/or next steps: Prepare for the implementation of the backend business logic and API endpoints

Description of completed task:
Determine the categories of spot_category. 
Collected and integrated real-world spot data using NYC Open Data and the Overpass Turbo API.
Challenges and/or next steps: The raw data was messy. NYC Open Data and OpenStreetMap used different formats and naming conventions, so I spent time figuring out a unified schema that could handle both without losing key info.

Description of completed task:
Processed and inserted 23,000+ real-world spot records
into the database for testing purposes.
Challenges and/or next steps: Hit unexpected database issues. The generated SQL was too large for MySQL’s default limits, and I had to fix the import by rewriting scripts to sanitize problematic characters.

Description of completed task: Design prototypes and create a set of images using Google Gemini.
Challenges and/or next steps: Since I’m not familiar with Figma, I hand-drew a prototype and then used Google Gemini to generate the project prototypes and an image set.
Reflection: It was a very interesting experience. Normally, product managers provide prototypes, but for this independent project, I had to come up with another solution.

Description of completed task:
Sent the weekly report to the supervisor 
and PMed him to discuss the next tasks.
Analyzing which APIs are needed for the backend.

Built the backend skeleton. Created empty Controllers, 
Services, and Repositories for all 9 entities 
(just the shell, no business logic yet). 
Also configured the core infrastructure like JWT, Redis, 
and Global Exception Handler.
Challenges and/or next steps: Next step: Start implementing the actual business logic, beginning with the User and Spot modules.
Reflection: Setting up the structure first makes me feel organized. Now I can just focus on filling in the logic.

Description of completed task:
Synced everything to GitHub. 
Pushed the new backend skeleton code, 
the updated timelog.csv, and the folder of 
prototype images.
